metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15132 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Zabbix through 4.4.0alpha1 allows User Enumeration. With login requests, it is possible to enumerate application usernames based on the variability of server responses (e.g., the "Login name or password is incorrect" and "No permissions for system access" messages, or just blocking for a number of seconds). This affects both api_jsonrpc.php and index.php. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled failed login attempts. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to enumerate users.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
